questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company is using Microsoft Power Platform.

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

comments.content:
Journeys is for marketing and approaching possible customers
Sales is used to "persuade" customers got using Journeys (or other adv struments) to buy the package.
And Customer Voice is used to collect surveys from customers. 
So the right answer is Data

questions.question_text:
You need a product that can display customer information from multiple sources in silos.

Which product should you select?

DRAG DROP
-

A company is evaluating how information is stored in Dynamics 365 Sales when the company uses a web client.

You need to identify the storage methods for each data type.

Which storage method should you identify? To answer, move the appropriate storage methods to the correct data types. You may use each storage method once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to move the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Data: Cloud
Metadata: Cloud
Security roles: Cloud

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales to manage its sales process.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
A company plans to implement Dynamics 365 Sales with LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
You need to determine the controls that you should implement.
Which controls should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate controls to the correct requirement. Each control may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct
The LinkedIn Sales Navigator Lead control shows information about a LinkedIn member profile. 
The LinkedIn Sales Navigator Account control shows information about a LinkedIn company profile

comments.content: Perfect, there is no better explanation.

discussion.content: Was on exam 15/09. Correct like HaCha explained.

comments.content: Microsoft acquired LinkedIn, so not that unusual :)
